main event: A round object was observed traveling quickly in the sky in New Jersey on October 6, 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as dim yellow-orange and was estimated to take one minute to cross the sky., The sighting lasted for only 2 seconds., The object was estimated to follow a course towards the northeast., Observers included civilian military pilots., The evidence indicated that the sighting was likely a meteor.
witness description: civilian military pilots, Sohn F. Smith and Thomas H. Goff
